law.text: [ Text of section effective until January 1, 2013. For text effective January 1, 2013, see below.] The state treasurer shall have the custody and keep a separate account of all notes, bonds and mortgages belonging to the commonwealth, and shall receive all money accruing therefrom. All deeds and instruments conveying real estate to the commonwealth shall, when recorded, be deposited with and safely kept by him. Such records shall not include those pertaining to real property acquired for the use of state agencies, pursuant to section forty M of chapter 7. Chapter 29: Bonds, etc., of commonwealth; custody [ Text of section as recodified by 2012, 165, Sec. 112 effective January 1, 2013. See 2012, 165, Sec. 137. For text effective until January 1, 2013, see above.] The state treasurer shall have the custody and keep a separate account of all notes, bonds and mortgages belonging to the commonwealth, and shall receive all money accruing therefrom. All deeds and instruments conveying real estate to the commonwealth shall, when recorded, be deposited with and safely kept by the state treasurer. Such records shall not include those pertaining to real property acquired for the use of state agencies, under sections 32, 33 and 39 of chapter 7C.
